luas package#

luas.GPClass module#

class luas.GPClass.GP(initial_params: dict, mfp_to_fit: list[str], hp_to_fit: list[str], x_l: Union[ndarray, Array], x_t: Union[ndarray, Array], Y: Union[ndarray, Array], kf: Kernel, mf: Optional[Callable] = None, logPrior: Optional[Callable] = None, gaussian_prior_dict: Optional[Dict] = None, log_params: Optional[list[str]] = None, transform_fn: Optional[Callable] = None, transform_args: Any = None)[source]#

Bases: object

GP class using the Kronecker product structure of the covariance matrix to extend GPs to 2D regular structures relatively cheaply.

|
|
|

x_l (N_l) | Y (N_l x N_t) data | input | |

|
| ——————————– x_t (N_t) input

Must be two input dimensions, and each are treated independently to create a kernel in each dimension. These are then combined with the sum of two Kronecker products to produce the full covariance matrix, although using eigendecomposition allows us to avoid computing and inverting huge matrices.

Kl and Sl (both MxM) will be the covariance matrices in the wavelength/vertical direction, Kt and St (both NxN) will be the covariance matrices in the time/horizontal direction. The full covariance is given by K = (Kl KRON Kt + Sl KRON St).

Parameters:

  • initial_params (PyTree) – dictionary of starting guesses for mean function parameters and hyperparameters

  • mfp_to_fit (list) – a list of the names of mean function parameters which are being fit (i.e. not fixed)

  • hp_to_fit (list) – a list of the names of hyperparameters which are being fit (i.e. not fixed)

  • x_l (JAXArray) – array containing wavelength dimension

  • x_t (JAXArray) – array containing time dimension

  • Y (JAXArray) – 2D array containing the observed data

  • kf (Kernel) – kernel object which has already been initialised with the desired kernel function

  • mf (Callable, optional) – mean function, by default returns zeros. Needs to be in the format mf(p, x_l, x_t)

  • logPrior (Callable, optional) – log prior function, optional as PyMC can also be used for priors but more complex priors can be used with this

  • log_params (list, optional) – list of variable names which it is desired to fit for the log of the parameter (uses log base 10)

  • transform_fn (Callable, optional) – function for transforming variables being fit to variable values. Where log parameters are transformed

  • transform_args (tuple, optional) – arguments to transform_fn. If using default transform_fn then this can be left as None

luas.kernel_functions module#

luas.kernel_functions.cosine_kernel(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#
luas.kernel_functions.distanceL1(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array]) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#
luas.kernel_functions.distanceL2(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array]) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#
luas.kernel_functions.evaluate_kernel(kernel_fn: Callable, x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Uses JAX’s vmap function to efficiently build the covariance matrix from a given kernel function

Parameters:

  • kernel_fn (Callable) – The desired kernel function to use

  • x (JAXArray) – Input vector 1

  • y (JAXArray) – Input vector 2

  • l (Scalar) – The length scale for the kernel function

Returns:

The constructed covariance matrix

Return type:

JAXArray

luas.kernel_functions.exp_sine_squared_kernel(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Exponential sine squared kernel, used with evaluate_kernel to build covariance matrices which have periodic covariance.

Parameters:

  • x (JAXArray) – Input vector 1

  • y (JAXArray) – Input vector 2

  • l (Scalar) – The length scale to use

Returns:

Covariance between two input vectors

Return type:

JAXArray

luas.kernel_functions.matern32_kernel(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Matern 3/2 kernel function, used with evaluate_kernel to build covariance matrices.

Parameters:

  • x (JAXArray) – Input vector 1

  • y (JAXArray) – Input vector 2

  • l (Scalar) – The length scale to use

Returns:

Covariance between two input vectors

Return type:

Scalar

luas.kernel_functions.matern52_kernel(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Matern 5/2 kernel function, used with evaluate_kernel to build covariance matrices.

Parameters:

  • x (JAXArray) – Input vector 1

  • y (JAXArray) – Input vector 2

  • l (Scalar) – The length scale to use

Returns:

Covariance between two input vectors

Return type:

Scalar

luas.kernel_functions.rational_quadratic_kernel(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any, alpha: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Rational quadratic kernel function, used with evaluate_kernel to build covariance matrices.

Parameters:

  • x (JAXArray) – Input vector 1

  • y (JAXArray) – Input vector 2

  • l (Scalar) – The length scale to use

Returns:

Covariance between two input vectors

Return type:

Scalar

luas.kernel_functions.squared_exp_kernel(x: Union[ndarray, Array], y: Union[ndarray, Array], l: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Squared exponential kernel function, also known as the radial basis function, used with evaluate_kernel to build a covariance matrix.

\[k(x, y) = \exp\Bigg( -\frac{|x - y|^2}{2l^2}\Bigg)\]
Parameters:

  • x (JAXArray) – Input vector 1

  • y (JAXArray) – Input vector 2

  • l (Scalar) – The length scale to use

Returns:

Covariance between two input vectors

Return type:

Scalar

luas.kronecker_functions module#

luas.kronecker_functions.kron_prod(A: Union[ndarray, Array], B: Union[ndarray, Array], R: Union[ndarray, Array]) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Function for converting a vector of length N_l * N_t into an array of the same shape as the input data Y into a vector.

Parameters:

  • r (JAXArray) – Vector of size N_l * N_t

  • N_l (int) – Size of first dimension l

  • N_t (int) – Size of second dimension t

Returns:

The result of multiplying the matrix A KRON B times the vector R as a JAXArray array of shape (N_l, N_t).

luas.kronecker_functions.kronecker_inv_vec(R: Union[ndarray, Array], storage_dict: Any) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Function for converting a vector of length N_l * N_t into an array of the same shape as the input data Y into a vector.

Parameters:

  • R (JAXArray) – Array of shape (N_l, N_t)

  • storage_dict (PyTree) – PyTree storing information about decomposition of the covariance matrix

Returns:

The product of the inverse of the covariance matrix multiplied on the right by the vector represented by R as a JAXArray array of shape (N_l, N_t).

luas.kronecker_functions.make_mat(r: Union[ndarray, Array], N_l: int, N_t: int) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Function for converting a vector of length N_l * N_t into an array of the same shape as the input data Y into a vector.

Parameters:

  • r (JAXArray) – Vector of size N_l * N_t

  • N_l (int) – Size of first dimension l

  • N_t (int) – Size of second dimension t

Returns:

A JAXArray array of shape (N_l, N_t)

luas.kronecker_functions.make_vec(R: Union[ndarray, Array]) → Union[ndarray, Array][source]#

Function for converting a matrix of the same shape as the input data Y into a vector.

Parameters:

R (JAXArray) – Matrix of shape (N_l, N_t)

Returns:

A JAXArray vector of length N_l * N_t
